physical_appearance: "The image shows a colour transparency. ""Ektachrome Transparency"" is stated at the top and inverted at the bottom. The image at the centre is dark red in colour. It shows a silhouette of a junk ship to the right hand side. At the left hand side are more silhouettes of buildings. "
sgcool_label_text: This Ektachrome colour transparency shows a series of movie posters of films showing at the Pavilion, New Alhambra, Cathay and Odeon cinemas in Singapore, with a docked junk ship at a distance. Inscribed on the verso are ‘8.9.57’ and ‘Junk and Modern Living’. Ektachrome was a range of transparency and still films developed by the Eastman Kodak Company in the early 1940s.
